availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Parks (McLean County and Hopkins County, Ky, farmer and laborer )

body.p: McLean County and Hopkins County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Hood Parks in Warren County, Kentucky, in September 1845. Father of Susan Parks, Martha J. Parks, Lenny E. Parks, Cynthia Parks, Samuel W. Parks, James H. Parks, William A. Parks, Sarah A. Parks, Zillman Parks, Amanda Parks, and Mary E. Parks. Laborer in McLean County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Madisonville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, p. 53.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 37B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000164005.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, September 1863, p. 16.
